Module com.cyte.edamame
Package com.cyte.edamame.editor

Class Editor

java.lang.Object
com.cyte.edamame.editor.Editor
Direct Known Subclasses:
FootprintEditor, PCBEditor, SchematicEditor, SymbolEditor
public abstract class Editor extends Object
Librarys and projects are all modified through the use of special purpose editor modules.

All Controller_Editors are based on the abstract Editor class so that they conform with what the EDAmame main application expects and will attempt to obtain and display editor specific controls for.

Author:
Jeff Wiegley, Ph.D., jeffrey.wiegley@gmail.com

  • Field Details

    • Editor_ID

      final UUID Editor_ID
      Every editor can be uniquely identified by a random UUID (which do not persist across application execution.

    • Editor_Tab

      protected javafx.scene.control.Tab Editor_Tab
      The main Editor_Tab for EDAmame to include in its main Editor_Tab list.

    • Editor_ToolBar

      protected javafx.scene.control.ToolBar Editor_ToolBar

    • Editor_Tabs

      protected javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.control.Tab> Editor_Tabs
      a list of Editor_Tabs to include in the navigation Editor_Tab pane when this editor is active. (can be empty)

    • Editor_Menus

      protected javafx.collections.ObservableMap<String,javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.control.MenuItem>> Editor_Menus
      A structure of menu items to include in EDAmame's Editor_Menus. Any menuitems associated with a string will be inserted/visible under the menu with the same name in the EDAmame main menubar. The string must match exactly including mneumonic underscores and such. Missing Editor_Menus at the EDAmame level are not created.

    • Editor_GetTab

      public javafx.scene.control.Tab Editor_GetTab()
      Returns the main editor Tab node for inclusion by EDAmame.
      Returns:
      the main Editor_Tab for this editor.

    • Editor_GetToolBar

      public javafx.scene.control.ToolBar Editor_GetToolBar()
      Returns the optional ToolBar of this editor for inclusion by EDAmame.
      Returns:
      The ToolBar if available, null otherwise.

    • Editor_GetControlTabs

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.control.Tab> Editor_GetControlTabs()
      Returns a list of control Editor_Tabs for EDAmame to include in the main controls Editor_Tab pane.
      Returns:
      A (possibly empty) list of control Editor_Tabs.

    • Editor_GetMenus

      public javafx.collections.ObservableMap<String,javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.control.MenuItem>> Editor_GetMenus()
      Returns a (possibly empty) structure of menu items for EDAmame to include in its Editor_Menus. The top Map maps menu names to a list of items to include in a menu with that name. The values of this map are a list of MenuItems that EDAmame should include/insert into any menu it has with a matching name.
      Returns:
      a (possibly empty) structure of menu items

    • Editor_Dissect

      protected void Editor_Dissect(javafx.scene.Scene scene) throws InvalidClassException
      Editor_Dissect a controller into its component for delivery to EDAmame

      The design of Controller_Editors is intended to be done through FXML and SceneBuilder. SceneBuilder doesn't support multiple scenes in a single FXML. So, all required components are boxed into a single VBOX. Once an editor factory has loaded an FXML file which

      Parameters:
      scene - The scene to Editor_Dissect for expected UI elements.
      Throws:
      InvalidClassException - if the expected UI scene organization is not found as expected.

    • close

      public boolean close()
      Request an editor to close. Handling any information/state saving as it needs.
      Returns:
      true if the editor was able to close without unsaved information/state, false otherwise.
